title.narrative: Building resilient communities in Nicaragua's dry corridor

description.narrative: This project has been proposed as a second stage of NIC240 (third party support linked to ICD1016). This additional support has been possible by the GDF Funding Application – Latin America Human Rights Defender Programme considering the reflections and feedback shared during an evaluation session held in November 2021 with local women leaders involved in that process. An example about the nature and impact of the previous work is available here: https://cafod.org.uk/News/International-news/Climate-crisis-poem The current initiative has a local approach in order to work on the most critical needs across the dry corridor in Nicaragua. In this region of the country, the rural population has historically been deprived of its rights of access to land, food security and healthy food, access to quality water for human consumption. in addition, Nicaragua is facing a political, social and economic crisis since 2018. The lack of Rule of Law and polarisation has produced increasing barriers to civil rights, especially for women. The planned activities will provide training to social leaders and information to rural communities inspired in the in the encyclicals "Laudato Si" and "Fratelli tutti". During the process, the use of ICT will be encouraged to influence in the public opinion, promoting cultural changes. In addition, efforts will be joined with local networks for the defence of the environment, aimed to non-deforestation, water sanitation, adaptation to climate change, agroecological practices and women´s empowerment.
